intro: Thrixspermum australe, commonly known as the Australian thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Thrixspermum australe is typically found in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
